results.title: Screen magazine. No. 23
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine item: Danish children build Greek school - In 1949 a United Nations Appeal was made for help in Greece. From Denmark came a plan to build and equip a complete school, paid for by Danish children. Students who were experts in building came to live and work in the Greek village, others had to learn the trade. The Danish students were joined by young people from other countries and in two years the school was finished.

results.title: Screen magazine. No. 20. [Birthday for Eritrea]
results.brief_description: Eritrea, situated on the African continent and long known as an Italian colony, has become self-governing and has federated with Ethiopia. Through the work of the United Nationa, Eritrea’s future has been decided, for the first time in her history, by peaceful negotiations. Since the ending of colonial rule, Eritrea was guided by British adminstration, which organised an indigenous police force, established a new public school system and gave Eritreans a chance to administer justice in their local courts.

Illustrates how the people of Greece may decide what they need most and then build it (roads, land drains, flood barriers, harbour jetties, town water supplies, sewer systems etc.) with the aid of advice and suggestions from the United Nations.

results.title: Screen actors
results.creator_credit: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Motion Picture actors are seen in their homes, conducting important business of their craft through Screen Actors Guild and meeting the problems of everyday living the same as other citizens. The film is concerned mainly with presenting film actors as ordinary people. Reginald Denny is an aeronautical engineer; Esther Williams a successful business woman; Clark Gable as a keen rancher; Lionel Barrymore a talented artist.

results.title: Screamin' wheelies
results.brief_description: This amusing documentary examines wheelchair basketball, played at Paralympic level in Australia. Filmmaker Fiona Cochrane presents the athletic abilities of the men’s and women’s teams whilst displaying their incredibly positive attitudes. Numerous interviewees discuss their reaction to being told they had a disability, the ensuing struggles, and the hope and direction that wheelchair basketball has given them. Other interviewees includes family members, and coaches of the teams. Inspiring stories.
